paper_abstract: In this paper, we study the second-order three-point boundary value problem u ''(t) + f(t, u(t), u' (t)) = theta, 0 < t < 1, u'(0) = theta, u(1) = alpha u(eta) in a Banach space E, where theta is the zero element of E, 0 < alpha < 1, 0 < eta < 1. By using the Sadovskii fixed point theorem, we get the existence of at least one (positive) solution. As an application, we give an example to demonstrate our results. (c) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Existence of solutions of three-point boundary value problems in Banach spaces
